status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):cancelled (2):offer submitted by Eryn Reichert (3):offer submitted by Eryn Reichert (4):sor submitted / draft by Eryn Reichert

scope_of_work.notes: Works to be completed ASAP (specialist parts lead-time dependent).
scope_of_work.problem: Pumps 1, 8 & 9 have been identified as requiring motor bearing replacements.
scope_of_work.scope: Supply of 1x new 75kW motor to minimise pump down time.Remove existing Pump8 motor and install new 75kW motor - test & commission.Refurbish Pump8 motor (new motor bearings and seals).Remove existing Pump9 motor and install refurbished Pump8 75kW motor - test & commission.Refurbish Pump9 motor (new motor bearings and seals).Remove existing Pump1 motor and install refurbished Pump9 75kW motor - test & commission.Refurbish Pump1 motor (new motor bearings and seals) to provide future pump motor redundancy.
scope_of_work.justification: Specialist OEM recommendation.Pumps 8 & 9 both supply Chilled Water to E1 West Machine Room.If both Pumps 8 & 9 were to fail, the NHB site would lose cooling to @33% of the critical DC whitespace.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: Continued increased risk to @33% of the critical DC whitespace.

status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):cancelled by Bilal (2):offer submitted by Jayme Feil (3):sor submitted / draft by Jayme Feil

scope_of_work.problem: STS39 Static Switch 2 SCR shorted in inactive stack, thyristor failure 25.08.24. Resilience at STS is N. SEV2 condition.
scope_of_work.scope: CBRE and Piller UK call outs. Initial investigation and replacement of A102 SS2 firing board.This was unsuccessful. Follow up visit with additional costs required.
scope_of_work.justification: Resilience reduced to N. SEV2 condition.

project_name: UPM-STS39 Static Switch 2 SCR shorted in inactive stack, thyristor failure. Part 2 - Second visit and possibility of additional replacement parts
status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):revised by Jayme Feil (2):offer submitted by Jayme Feil (3):offer submitted by Jayme Feil (4):sor submitted / draft by Jayme Feil

scope_of_work.notes: This LSE (Budget Cost) is based on the anticipated worse case of having to replace the main STS CPU but it is not a guarantee of the STS being reinstated to full functionality.The budget cost is based on the replacement cost of STS24 (CSD) main CPU replacement in April 2024, Small Job UK-2024-36 with £1000 additional contingency.
scope_of_work.problem: STS39 Source 2 Thyristor failure 25.08.24 required the replacement of the Source 2 firing board A102 but on reboot up, additional issues were apparent with Source 2 voltage not being measured and seen by the system. The STS had to be left in Source 1 bypass (Resilience at STS reduced to N).STS39 is feeding PDU39 on Source 1 (DRUPS1) in fixed bypass, thus if DRUPS 1 fails to start in a Mains Fail, STS39 is unable to swap to its alternative Source 2 (DRUPS 2). The supply at PDU39 will be lost but providing all equipment is dual corded with second source STS38 (PDU38) and the server equipment operates as designed, the load will transfer to PDU38.Current load detail:PDU39 L1-15.2 Amps, L2-6.4 Amps, L3-10.8 AmpsPDU38 L1-15.9 Amps, L2-8.4 Amps, L3-10.6 Amps
scope_of_work.scope: Further investigation by OEM (Piller UK). Checking of breakers, cabling, firing card and main CPU.
scope_of_work.justification: The STS second source provides a no break transfer path of the PDU39 load in the event of DRUPS1 failing to start in a Mains Fail condition or a failure condition of the sub-mains cable feeding Source 1 of STS39. See also Problem Statement above
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: Resilience at STS39 remains at N

project_name: UPM-DRUPS Loadbank for October 24 Quarterly load run post minor service
status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):cancelled by Bilal (2):sor submitted / draft by Jayme Feil

scope_of_work.problem: DRUPS is due it's next quarterly load run at >35% load in October 2024 as per best practice. Current business load does not provide enough load so the hire of a 600kW load bank is required.
scope_of_work.scope: Hire and connection, disconnection of 600kW load bank with inline 1250A MCCB issue of PTWs/ICs Delivery of load bank.
scope_of_work.justification: Maintain the DRUPS generator reliability and prevent wet stacking of generators due to low load conditions
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: Increased risk of generator failure, reduction of DRUPS reliability

project_name: UPM-Kyndryl UK Radio & TV License Renewal
status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):cancelled by Bilal (2):offer approved by Miss Maymie Sporer (3):offer submitted by Miss Maymie Sporer (4):sor submitted / draft by Miss Maymie Sporer

scope_of_work.notes: Purchase of Licenses mentioned above (3 x TV Licenses and 1 x Radio License) to cover the 3 x UK Locations. Warwick, North Harbour & Greenford
scope_of_work.problem: The annual Radio License and TV License is due for the 3 x UK Locations (Warwick, North Harbour & Greenford). The Radio license is required so that site radios can be used on site. The TV License is required to allow broadcast of News etc. at the locations mentioned
scope_of_work.scope: Purchase of Radio License through Ofcom to be made prior to 31st October 2024 alongside payment to TV Licensing to enable continuation of the licenses mentioned above
scope_of_work.justification: If these licenses are not renewed then TV services will not be able to be broadcast across the locations. The same applies for the Radio License, if this is not renewed then site radios will not be able to be used, site radios are used to communicate within the Operations Team and Security for critical alarms or issues on site for day to day activities
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: TV Services and Radio usage will no longer be able to be used on site. If these licenses are not renewed, we will be in breach of your licence terms and conditions and will be operating illegally. This may result in revocation of our licence(s) and possible enforcement action.

project_name: Phase 1 Chillers - Recalibration & Testing of 24 Pressure Release Valves
status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):cancelled by Jayme Feil (2):sor submitted / draft by Jayme Feil

scope_of_work.notes: Quote validity 90 days. This work is an Fgas Regulation statutory requirement and a Kyndryl critical plant insurance requirement. Completion required by February 2025.
scope_of_work.scope: Specialist contractor to recalibrate & test 24 Pressure Release Valves for Phase 1 Chillers (1, 2 & 3).One chiller at a time will be shutdown, system resilience reduced from N+2 to N+1 and will have their 8 PRVs removed from the chiller for on site recalibration and testing then reconnected to the chiller. The chillers will be re-sequenced through a SOP (FSP) until all the chiller PRVs are completed.

project_name: UPM-Phase 1 Chillers - Recalibration & Testing of 24 Pressure Release Valves and HP safety switches
status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):cancelled (2):offer submitted by Jayme Feil (3):sor submitted / draft by Jayme Feil

scope_of_work.notes: Quote validity 90 days. This work is an Fgas Regulation statutory requirement and a Kyndryl critical plant insurance requirement. Completion required by February 2025.
scope_of_work.problem: Phase 1 Chillers - Recalibration & Testing of 24 Pressure Release Valves and HP safety switches - Requirement due for completion in February 2025.
scope_of_work.scope: Specialist contractor to recalibrate & test 24 Pressure Release Valves for Phase 1 Chillers (1, 2 & 3).One chiller at a time will be shutdown, system resiliencereduced from N+2 to N+1 and will have their 8 PRVs removed from the chiller foron site recalibration and testing then reconnected to the chiller. The chillerswill be re-sequenced through a SOP (FSP) until all the chiller PRVs arecompleted. Once competed the chillers will have their HP safety switches tested with the insurance inspector to demonstrate they operate at the required pressure before the PRV threshold.
scope_of_work.justification: Each chiller has 304kg of refrigerant R134A and under FGas Regulations it is a requirement to have calibrated high pressure relief valves on the system, checked and tested every 48 months to ensure they operate at the desired threshold and the chiller shutdown HP switches operate before that threshold in order for the gas not to be released to atmosphere.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: FGas regulations and Kyndryl insurance requirement

status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):cancelled by Neil Hauck (2):offer submitted by Neil Hauck (3):offer submitted by Neil Hauck (4):offer submitted by Neil Hauck (5):sor submitted / draft by Neil Hauck

scope_of_work.problem: Following routine maintenance, specialist Service Report has identified a minor leak on Switchroom4 Stulz cooling unit and faulty Suction Transducers.
scope_of_work.scope: 1. Recover remaining refrigerant into suitable recovery cylinder.2. Lock off compressor to prevent it starting during pressure test. 3. Replace suction transducers. 4. Pressurise system, find leak and repair if possible.5. Providing it passes pressure leak test, evacuate system.6. Charge virgin refrigerant 7. Test and run unit 8. Complete paperwork and issue to client
scope_of_work.justification: Stulz cooling unit is required to maintain the temperature in Switchroom4, housing DC Critical A infrastructure services.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: Increased risk to DC Critical A infrastructure services.
